content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The mechanics and challenges in your puzzle are clear and easy to understand, fitting perfectly with its intended difficulty.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun puzzle, the description is verbose but it's clear & easy to understand.
Difficulty probably lies somewhere medium & hard, having it set as hard if fine.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: accept this contribution

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)
A very promising project.
An image would be nice to have a palpable idea of the factory and the possible rooms.

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)
A very promising project.

5DN1L, I can’t answer below your last message.
Could you please answer this message instead?

Thank you for your feedback.

Hi,

For the example, the instructions: p2 p2 tr tr p2 tr tr p2 tr tr tr tr p2 tr tr tr tr tr p2 tr tr would also bring you to the exit, turning on the exit seems to be allowed.
I don't see what in the statement will make these instructions invalid or make the the shorter one the one to output.

Goal
* First paragraph: Who is "her"? Would it be ok to change "help her fixing it" to "help to fix it"?

* Please format all instructions (including examples) as {{constants}} instead of [[variables]].

* Please format the meaning of the squares (the rooms) as {{constants}} instead of [[variables]].

* "Drop the following instructions in the set": Do you mean "(all) remaining"? If so, the meaning is clearer if you use "remaining" instead.

* "You can insert each instruction wherever you want.": Do you mean "an instruction" / "any instruction"? "Each instruction" seems to imply there is a specific set of instructions.

* "You must play the instructions one by one." but "You might not use all the instructions.": Is it because M.A.R.I. stops once it arrives at the exit? If so, please mention that.

* "already engaged": What do you mean?

* In the statement, when you mention "instructions" / "list" / "instruction list", are you referring to input instructions or output instructions?

* The rooms - k: Suggest to mention "k" is a key. Please also format "p2" as a {{constant}}.

* The rooms - k: What does "door" refer to? A see-saw door? 

* The rooms - dd: What is a see-saw door? I can't find any results in Google.

* The rooms - dd: How does the see-saw door move?

Constraints
* Please format "nop" as a {{constant}}.

Thanks.
"her" is M.A.R.I.
You can use an instruction in the list only once, like a card in a card game.
Oh weird. OK, the revised puzzle looks fine. Thank you for making the changes.
I removed the W square.
Ok I get it now, I didn't get that the first input is the list on instructions you have available.

Thank you, I edited the statement and the constraints.

For some reason, I can’t answer your message in another message below. I’ll do it here.

I also thought about such formatting, I’ll think about it.
Feel free to create tests and validators by yourself, I’ll add them (and modify my script).

Finished the puzzle, really liked it.
Here's a couple remarks:

- I would format the output with several lines as it's easier to read, for example the first one instead of being "p2 p1 p2 p1 tr p2" it would be:
p2
p1 p2 
p1 tr p2

- I would try to create a test/validator where you can use "x2" twice, I assume you can't have an x2 following another x2 so it would check that you don't try to do that.
I would also say that x2 can't be the only instruction or the last instruction of the set.

- I assume you can't push the gear on a door, I would try to create a test/validator where this it checked, you could also have a one where you are forced to push the gear on the railway which then prevent the door to slide.
I changed the output.

Ah, I get it now. Previously I misunderstood that M.A.R.I. was the entity that had to be fixed.

The revised statement is clearer. New comments:

Goal
* The rooms: "M.A.R.I. must not go out!" but M.A.R.I. must reach the exit (exit = go out)…?

* Gear: Suggest to mention that M.A.R.I. cannot step on the gear.

* Gear: Suggest to add "to an empty square" after "push it".

* Sliding door: If the door has slid, does {{ddr}} become {{rdd}}? Suggest to mention it in the statement.

Constraints
* Please move the second constraint to "Goal - How to play".

Cases
* "W" is not featured in any cases. Do you plan to add any, or remove "W" from the list of meanings of the squares?

* Suggest to add one pair of cases where the test includes zl and the validator includes zr (i.e. the opposite of the current last pair of cases). If you plan to feature "W", you may do so here in this new pair too.

Thanks.
